title: Self-Organized Mathematics Learning Design Using Social Software

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational secondary mathematics concepts and basic problem-solving skills
context.additional_context: Students participate in collaborative problem-solving and knowledge sharing via social software tools (wikis, discussion forums, blogs) using personal devices. Learning outcomes are measured through project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Students document math problem-solving processes using wikis and complete final outputs by incorporating peer feedback at least three times.
Learners engage in mathematical discussions with peers at least twice weekly in discussion forums, improving their ability to present logical reasoning.
Learners record math concept application cases and write reflective learning journals over four weeks via personal blogs.
Learners self-organize to solve complex math problems in small team projects and produce presentation materials.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
